reviews.sentence: Too much for too little. I stayed at this hotel for 2 days for a conference. For what they charged the level of service and the quality of the food was not worth the money. The room service food was terribly over priced 35 for a grilled cheese sandwich can of diet coke and slice of chocolate cake. On top of that the waiter forgot my drink. Additionally when placing the room service order it was as if I was being a burden to the guy taking the order because I asked him i they could make a grilled cheese sandwich which was not on the menu nothing vegetarian on their menu. I had lunch at Shulas Restaurant and the only person that was serving food was the bartender who was totally overwhelmed by the 8 people in the bar. It took forever to get serviced and the quality of my tuna sandwich was not that great. When the hostess came to take my drink order I was going to order food and she said that was not her job. I would be and expect to be. fired if I said that at my job. Lastly the food in the hotel at the conference was pretty bad as well. All in all a bad experience. The one good thing was bed. Very comfortable.

Nice staff convenient location parking but allergy trigger bathroom mildew mold. The staff was nice. Nice check in lady offered activity books for the kids. 3 pm is a very busy time to check in on a Saturday expect to wait at least 15 minutes. Pool overchlorinated with only 1 unisex bathroom howerver towels ready for you to use so you do not have to bring your own and a nice workout gym. Beds had older mattresses which were not comfy. Pillows squishy not supportive. Completely not like the Westin in Atlanta which was uber clean and uber comfy. Mildew problems at the Westin in Indianapolis top floor room 1505. Bathroom cracks and creases mildew both pink and black and a rusty screw noted holding up the soap dish in the shower. The hallway was extremely hot as if they only open or air condition it when they are full. I noticed I started having a runny nose when we were in the room before and after dinner. After one night my mold allergies were flaring and both my daughter and I were sniffling and congested. I did let them know when we checked out that the room needed attention before anyone else should be put in there. If the kids had not already been sleeping I would have asked for a new room. Coffee pods nice that they are Starbucks but are too big for the cup brewer and so if not careful hot water spills out the side while brewing creating scalding hazard if you have kids. Nice having a mini fridge bathrobe cable TV and desk. I did notify the front desk man when checking out of the mildew and allergy situation. He thought I had feather allergies related to the down pillows to which I laughed and said I own a whole flock of chickens with no allergy problem normally. I rarely have allergic reactions sniffles congestion to things in the air except to major dust. Parking is convenient but about 30 per day self park. Convenient walking location to restaurants within 2 3 blocks. Between the main Illinois Blvd and Westin and Hyat on Washington many panhandlers some having territory disputes and the smell of stale human urine at the intersection. Later roving flocks of 30 50 unsupervised teenagers of high school age on a Saturday night outing taking up whole sidewalks and these were really wide walks.

Updated and convenient. First impression nice reception area. Then had to figure out how the elevator works along 10 other persons. Just push the button longer. The room was not aerated but that was easy fixed with ACIn an attempt to modernize the shower area flat head and funky portable shower cord were installed but very inefficient both. Also a bath robe was present instead of two. Spacious as compared with Fairway room that was higher priced. Also conveniently linked to the convention center by a corridor. The steak house lodged at first level above the reception is priced too high. We were not sure if breakfast was included and had no desire to figure this out. The parking was 24 for a whole day and then 9 per hour I believe. At the Mall parking is 22 per day. This was a pleasant stay and would return here.

Stay here. Just great. Nothing to complain about. We upgraded to one of the higher floors and 247 access to the room where they serve breakfast snacks etc. forgot name and it was worth it. Stunning view of Indys downtown. The beds were so comfortable. I would highly recommend upgrading. The service was great. We went to a conference in the Convention Center and it was connected by a covered walkway bridge. So inclement weather is not an issue. The location is prime. Just do not go outside at night. well just watch the news. There are a gazillion cops around for a reason. But if you are fixed on visiting Indy this is the place.
Location. Parking. we parked in the adjacent garage and it cost 900 for the conference time.

Nice hotel for the price. My husband and I stayed for 2 nights while in town for business at the nearby convention center. Very nice clean updated place to stay. It was nice being able to stay indoors to walk to both the convention center and mall. Would stay again if in the area.

Valentines Day getaway. Great hotel with great service. we booked a King suite for two nights. when we arrived they told us they were overboked put us in a room with two queen beds and gave us free breakfast for our entire stay. we were able to move the following day to a King suite. I seldom complain. the queen beds were very small and the bathrooms are tiny. we are small people. but overall I would definitely stay again. hotel was connected to downtown mall. concierge was very helpful.

Stay for Graduation weekend. The service was very nice and the room clean. Except for someone elses food in our refrigerator. The only thing I did not like was scanning your room card to go up the elevator. it is a great idea however you had to scan it several times before it would work. Bed was comfy pillows also. Location was awesome walking distance to bars restaurants and events.
Good. Room was too hot. Even when the thermostat was lowered to 65 the heat was still on.

The location was nice conveniently connected to the mall and other places via skywalk. It was clean and there was a good view from the room. Everything including parking and Wi Fi was extra expensive. You needed a key card to use the elevator which was annoying. The hotel was nice but I have stayed at La Quintas with a nicer pool bigger rooms and free WiFi. No bang for my buck.

it is great not doing the camper this year at Indy but I will never stay at a Westin Hotel again. Nice hotel but their policies are insane. Not even worth trying to explain. Do not stay at a Westin Hotel they are not a guest friendly hotel. Shulas Steakhouse was a disappointment on every level.

Great location. I stay here twice a year one week each stay. If you are in for a convention you just can not beat the location. Staff is great. Close to the beautiful river walk and great restaurants. Always quiet and peaceful.
The staff was very nice but not very informative. We will never stay there again. The parking fee is absolutely crazy bad. Over 25 for parking for 2 night terrible.

Excellent Location in Town. This is a very nice hotel. The rooms are large with very comfortable beds. Elegant interior design and very clean. You have easy walking access from the 2nd floor skyway to downtown mall restaurants and shopping as well as the Convention Center and Lucus Oil Stadium. If you have ever stayed here in the winter this is a huge plus. You will not need to take a coat when you are walking to any of these locations.

We had a great stay and felt the Westin tries provided very good service. I liked the comfort of the bed and pillows. A firm bed is a necessity for us. Although the bathroom is small and I prefer bathrooms with the vanity separated from the shower I loved the rainfall shower head and the hand held wand was great for washing my hair. Being a person who wears contacts I truly appreciated the magnified mirror. Awesome convenience for putting in my contacts. The TV was very nice and offering of free wifi to us was great. My husband and I found the staff to be top notch extremely nice and helpful. We felt the room was sufficient and comfortable as well. I feel the cost of the room could have been a better. deal. We frequently stay downtown for these volleyball tourneys. We generally pay 200 a night or considerably less. Our room for three nights was over 90. We also valet park and the Westin charges 45 dollars a day for that. I think a hotel of this caliber should include breakfast with their rooms and include a microwave in the room. Getting a staff member to help microwave something for us their alternative just is not for me. it is too inconvenient. So we did not eat dinner at Shulas because we did not want to deal with trying to heat up leftovers. The only other thing that would have been nice would have been to leave more coffee creamers in the room. I left a note that was most likely misunderstood because we ended up with extra soaps. Reolution. I traded the soaps for creamers with a maid in the hallway.

Great location was very busy during my visit April 7th 2018. Stayed in room 132 view of front of hotel fountain was not on during my visit. Parking for me ended up being easy and free lol parked on the Maryland St free parking after 9 pm and on Sunday could see my car from my window also able to remote start the car from the room. did not spend much time in the room but was clean and spacious. Got ta knock on the door about 1 am from a worker that said there was a smell of cigarettes on the floor so I guess she was trying to see where it came from. Worst part of the stay is the room door is right next to 1321 so heard them opening and shutting the door all night. All in all would stay again.

Excellent Overnight for Father and Son. My 8 year old son and I stayed at the Westin July 16th to the 17th. We had an excellent stay in a corner room suite. Parking was way over priced at 40 for an adjacent lot not owned by the Westin. Wish I would have paid attention to overnight 40 vs Valet of 45. I would have paid the extra to have it handled for us. When we arrived the area was open clean and all the workers were friendly. The door was opened for me every time I entered. My son used the revolving door. With our upgraded room we had access to the State Room. The State Room had cookies Pepsi Products Coffee and fruit. We got our moneys worth in the State Room. For breakfast it had cereal juices coffee breads biscuits and gravy potatoes eggs sausage fruit and other items. The room was on the 10th floor a corner suite with 2 rooms. A nice sitting room with a pull out couch a main bedroom with a king bed and a nice bathroom. The pull out couch was not comfortable at all but my 8 year old did not notice. As someone who has to have a fan or noise to sleep I did not sleep well. Would recommend taking a fan or solid noise. The a c kicking on and off is loud enough to wake me when I fell asleep. The location was the best part we could easily walk all over downtown. The mall and city circle are very close with a lot to do. I would 100 stay here again.
Went there for gencon events. The hotel was nice and had good event rooms.

Horrible experience with Priceline. We have always enjoyed our Westin stays in other cities. This was a first in Indianapolis and we went through Priceline. The elevator was pretty dirty. The room was cramped and the fold out sofa was a single. There was dust in the room on the lamps and shades but overall the room was clean. We slept good. In the morning the toilet overflowed not our fault and we could n’t shower. They sent a plumber and he admitted there was a plumbing issue with some new pipes. We were offered a new room but did n’t have time to jack around. They passed the buck to Priceline to refund us and Priceline passed it back to Westin who did nothing other than offer a few perks next time we stayed. Well we are not interested in a next time. A few snacks or a bit nicer room is not going to entice us. I ’m wondering if we got a substandard outdated room because we went through Priceline. Staff was not as helpful or friendly as the Hilton.

My favourite place to stay. My husband and I have travelled to Indianapolis every year for the past few years and we always stay at the Westin. The location is convenient and only a short walk to local eateries shops and the Lucas Oil Stadium. The hotel also has a “ sky walk ” enclosed walkway to the local shopping centre which is excellent when the weather is rainy and wet. The hotel rooms are always clean and the beds are comfy. There is a Starbucks in the lobby too which is great for our morning coffee. We always look forward to staying at the Westin Indianapolis.
Great location close to so much to see in Indy. Loved the view of the capital building.
The skywalk was nice kept u out of the elements and was connected to the mall.
Nice atmosphere. I had a hamburger and fries. My only problem was the French fries was not hot. Food price were good.

i wrote a review earlier and not sure it was received. this is my first anniversary choice place to stay. however new information i simply requested a late check out and was informed that is not possible due to occupancy. i have essentially lived in mariot hotels for business among many others and have never had an issue with late checkouts. they usually entail an extra hour or two late checkout. after being fairly rudely informed by andrew its not possible i asked to speak with AGM assistant general manager about the issue. she informed me that occupancy does not permit my late checkout and that too many people have requested a late checkout therefore I can not give any more late checkouts. way to make me feel special on my first anniversary i mistakenly chose to be here at this hotel. absolutely rediculous. mariot will always make the best possible acomodations for my stay. these people basically said others are priority and my request was apparently not good enough. will not be a repeat customer in these circumstances.
Huge friendly nice rooms comfy bed.

Great business stay. Great location for business in downtown Indy. Easy walk to restaurants and bars. Shopping close by. Clean hotel with nice facilities. Comfortable quiet room. Bathroom was bright and updated. Go green bus route for access to airport.

We like the location to Convention center and to surrounding businesses. Large room clean comfortable bed. Had left overs I wanted to warm up but no microwave. It seems that only 2 of 6 elevators were working the 2 of 3 nights we were there.
Very comfortable bed nice shower. Room big enough and furniture comfy. Pool small and noisy.

Rooms were very nice but hotel was too crowded. We stayed during a huge percussion conference and during the Bands Of America marching band contest. The hotel was too crowded the entire time and there was no room to walk thru the lobby area at night. I visited the hotel restaurant. Nourish for breakfast and the waiter was very rude. I asked to sit at a table by the window by myself and he was rude but allowed me to sit there his tip reflected his attitude. The rooms were very nice and the valet service was awesomeI enjoyed the under ground parking area and easy access to the hotel by elevator from the garage area. The hotel is very close to all great places to eat and drink and easily in walking distance to the convention center.
